definition: to follow the crowd/going with the tide
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
not following the crowd/to go against the tide

sentences.english: Conforming also makes people feel better about themselves by bolstering self-confidence.
sentences.chinese: 随大流可以增加自信使人们自我感觉更好。

sentences.english: Our preferences are shaped by the masses.
sentences.chinese: 我们的偏好其实是“随大流”的。

sentences.english: 2-Don't follow the crowd, follow your own way. Do what you love.
sentences.chinese: 不要随大流，走自己的路，做你所喜欢的。

sentences.english: People use conformity to ingratiate themselves with others.
sentences.chinese: 人们利用随大流来讨好其他人。

sentences.english: The people who truly succeed in life are those who didn’t follow the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 在生活中真正成功的人是那些不随大流的人。

sentences.english: The strong-minded rarely follow the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 意志坚强的人很少随大流。

sentences.english: On most issues, he followed the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分问题上，他都随大流。

sentences.english: I just do it to conform.
He is mainstream on most issues, but not all.
sentences.chinese: 虽然很多事他都随大流，但也有例外。

sentences.english: At the end I listened to them and started ignoring him and pulling faces.
sentences.chinese: 最后我也只能随大流，不理他又向他做鬼脸。

sentences.english: Social approval People use conformity to ingratiate themselves with others.
sentences.chinese: 社会认可人们利用随大流来讨好其他人。

definition: to say what everyone says (idiom)/to conform to what one perceives to be the majority view/to follow the herd
to follow blindly/to conform slavishly/unthinking obedience
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
not following the crowd/to go against the tide
to go with the tide/to blindly follow the crowd/to follow the trend
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to follow the crowd/to conform
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
hidebound by convention (idiom)
to be unconventional/independence of action
to fit in/to get on well with others/sociable/to form a mutually supportive group
to persist in one's views
without one's own opinions
